title: Learning Dexterous Hand Manipulation through Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn complex manipulation tasks by imitating human demonstrations. The model uses a combination of motion capture data and tactile feedback to improve the accuracy of learned policies.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Object Manipulation with a Robotic Hand
abstract: We develop an end-to-end reinforcement learning framework for multi-object manipulation tasks using a dexterous robotic hand. The model is trained in simulation and successfully transferred to real-world settings with minimal fine-tuning.

title: Efficient Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation via Hierarchical Policies
abstract: This paper introduces a hierarchical imitation learning framework that decomposes complex manipulation tasks into subtasks, enabling more efficient learning and better performance on challenging dexterous tasks.

title: End-to-End Learning of Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Reinforcement Learning
abstract: The paper proposes an end-to-end reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, where the policy is directly optimized through simulated environments. The approach achieves high-performance results in tasks such as object rotation and assembly.

title: Imitating Human Dexterity: A Deep Imitation Learning Approach for Robotic Hands
abstract: This work develops a deep imitation learning framework that mimics human dexterity by learning from high-quality human motion data. The model is applied to robotic hands to perform precise and natural manipulation tasks.

title: Adaptive Control for Dexterous Manipulation Using Model-Free Optimization
abstract: We present an adaptive control strategy that uses model-free optimization to adjust control parameters in real-time during dexterous manipulation tasks. The method improves robustness and adaptability to changing environmental conditions.

title: Efficient Policy Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes an efficient policy optimization method for dexterous hand manipulation, focusing on reducing training time while maintaining high task performance. The approach is validated on a range of complex manipulation scenarios.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands Using Learned Dynamics
abstract: We propose a model predictive control (MPC) approach that incorporates learned dynamics models to enhance the precision and stability of dexterous hand movements. The method improves control performance on complex manipulation tasks with real-time adaptation.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Control via Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We present an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to replicate human-like dexterous movements by learning from recorded human demonstrations. The model is trained using a combination of motion capture data and tactile feedback to improve task performance.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper introduces a model predictive control (MPC) approach for dexterous hands that improves robustness in uncertain and dynamic environments. The method is tested on a variety of manipulation tasks and shows significant improvements over traditional control methods.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper proposes an efficient optimization framework for dexterous manipulation tasks, focusing on minimizing energy consumption while maintaining task accuracy. The method is applied to both simulated and real robotic hands.

abstract: The paper presents optimization techniques for improving the efficiency and accuracy of dexterous object manipulation. It focuses on trajectory optimization and force control to achieve precise and robust interactions with objects.

abstract: This paper proposes a model-based control strategy using deep neural networks to enhance the precision and stability of dexterous hand movements. The approach is validated on both simulated and real-world robotic platforms.

abstract: This paper develops an end-to-end learning system that integrates vision, touch, and proprioception for dexterous hand manipulation. The model is trained using reinforcement learning and achieves high success rates in complex tasks.

abstract: This paper introduces a vision-language-action (VLA) model that enables robotic hands to perform complex manipulation tasks based on natural language instructions. The model is trained on multimodal data and achieves state-of-the-art results in task generalization.

title: Robust Control of Dexterous Hands with Model-Based Adaptation
abstract: This paper presents a model-based control strategy that adapts to changing environmental conditions, enhancing the reliability of dexterous hand manipulation.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation Policies
abstract: We propose an optimization method that accelerates policy learning for dexterous hand manipulation by reducing computational overhead while maintaining high task performance.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation Policies via Contrastive Imitation Learning
abstract: This paper introduces contrastive imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation, improving policy learning by distinguishing between successful and failed demonstration trajectories. The approach leads to more robust and generalizable manipulation policies.

title: Reinforcement Learning with Curriculum Learning for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This study applies curriculum learning to reinforcement learning for dexterous object manipulation, progressively increasing task complexity to improve learning efficiency and success rate. The method is validated on a variety of challenging manipulation tasks using a simulated robotic hand.

title: End-to-End Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Grasping and Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces an end-to-end reinforcement learning system that enables a robotic hand to grasp and manipulate objects in unstructured environments without explicit task-specific reward functions.

title: Real-Time Control of Dexterous Hands using Model Predictive Control and Neural Networks
abstract: This research combines model predictive control with deep neural networks to achieve real-time, high-precision control of dexterous robotic hands in dynamic environments.

title: Language-Guided Imitation Learning for Robotic Hand Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents a language-guided imitation learning framework that allows robotic hands to perform dexterous tasks by interpreting natural language instructions and mimicking human motions.

title: Multi-Task Vision-Language-Action Planning for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: We propose a multi-task VLA planning system that enables robotic hands to perform a variety of dexterous tasks by combining vision, language, and action planning modules.

title: Real-Time Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper presents a real-time optimization framework using model predictive control to enable precise and responsive dexterous manipulation in dynamic environments.

title: Learning to Grasp and Manipulate with Vision and Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We explore the use of vision and reinforcement learning to train a robotic hand to grasp and manipulate objects, achieving high success rates in complex scenarios.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision and Language Guidance via Multi-Modal Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper explores the integration of vision and language modalities to enhance dexterous manipulation in robotic hands. We propose a multi-modal reinforcement learning framework that leverages natural language instructions to guide complex object manipulation tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation through Imitation Learning with Human Demonstrations
abstract: This work presents an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn dexterous manipulation skills from human demonstrations. The model uses a hierarchical policy structure to generalize across different objects and tasks.

title: Optimization Techniques for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: The paper proposes new optimization techniques for improving the efficiency and accuracy of dexterous object manipulation. These methods are validated on both simulated and real-world robotic platforms.

title: Imitation Learning for Dexterous Grasping Using Deep Neural Networks
abstract: This work investigates the application of deep imitation learning for dexterous grasping tasks. The model is trained on a diverse set of human grasping demonstrations and achieves strong generalization across different object shapes and sizes.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Imitation and Self-Supervision
abstract: This work explores the combination of imitation learning and self-supervised learning to improve the performance of dexterous hand manipulation in unstructured environments. The model is trained using human demonstrations and then refined through self-supervised exploration.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation from Unstructured Demonstrations Using Imitation Learning
abstract: This paper proposes a method for learning dexterous manipulation from unstructured human demonstrations using imitation learning. The approach effectively generalizes to new objects and tasks without explicit reward shaping.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation via Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning with a Single-View Camera
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous manipulation using a single-view camera. The method leverages a learned policy to perform complex object manipulation tasks without explicit tactile feedback.

title: Dexterous Hand Control via Imitation Learning from Human Demonstrations
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables a robotic hand to learn dexterous manipulation skills from human demonstrations. The model is trained using a combination of motion capture and tactile data to improve task performance.

title: End-to-End Optimization of Dexterous Manipulation with Neural Networks
abstract: The paper presents an end-to-end optimization framework for dexterous manipulation using neural networks. It integrates perception, planning, and control into a unified architecture for improved performance.

title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Tasks
abstract: This paper explores multi-task reinforcement learning for dexterous manipulation, demonstrating how shared representations can improve generalization across different object manipulation tasks.

title: Optimal Policy Search for Dexterous Manipulation Using Bayesian Optimization
abstract: This paper applies Bayesian optimization to find optimal policies for dexterous manipulation tasks, demonstrating improved efficiency and performance compared to traditional methods.

title: Imitating Human Grasping Skills Using Deep Imitation Learning
abstract: This study focuses on imitating human grasping skills through deep imitation learning. The proposed method uses neural networks to map observed human actions to robotic hand movements, achieving high success rates in various grasping tasks.

title: Efficient Optimization for Real-Time Robotic Hand Control
abstract: This paper introduces an efficient optimization algorithm for real-time control of dexterous robotic hands. The method reduces computational overhead while maintaining high precision and responsiveness in manipulation tasks.

title: VLA-Based Dexterous Manipulation Planning
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Motion Planning for Multi-Finger Manipulation
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: End-to-End Imitation Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Dynamic Obstacles
abstract: This paper introduces an end-to-end imitation learning approach that enables robotic hands to manipulate objects in dynamic and uncertain environments by learning from expert demonstrations under varying conditions.

title: A Unified Framework for Dexterous Manipulation via Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: This work develops a unified framework that combines vision, language, and action modalities to enable dexterous manipulation of objects through natural language commands, improving generalization across different tasks and environments.

title: Learning Robust Policies for Dexterous Manipulation using Model Predictive Control
abstract: This paper explores the integration of model predictive control (MPC) with deep reinforcement learning to develop robust policies for dexterous manipulation tasks, enhancing both accuracy and adaptability in real-world settings.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Hand Movements with Sparse Rewards
abstract: The paper addresses the challenge of sparse reward learning in dexterous hand manipulation by proposing an efficient optimization method that improves sample efficiency and task success rates in complex manipulation scenarios.

title: Reinforcement Learning with Curiosity-Driven Exploration for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper introduces a curiosity-driven exploration mechanism to enhance reinforcement learning for dexterous object manipulation, allowing the agent to discover new manipulation strategies and improve performance on challenging tasks.

title: Energy-Efficient Control of Robotic Hands
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Trajectory Optimization for Dexterous Grasping
abstract: We propose optimization techniques for generating smooth and efficient trajectories for dexterous grasping operations. The method considers both kinematic constraints and dynamic stability requirements.

title: Imitating Human Hand Movements for Robotic Manipulation via Imitation Learning
abstract: We propose an imitation learning framework that enables robotic hands to learn complex manipulation tasks by imitating human demonstrations. The model is trained on a large dataset of human hand motions and shows strong performance on unseen tasks.

title: Dexterous Manipulation with Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning and Visual Attention
abstract: We develop a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework that incorporates visual attention mechanisms to improve the efficiency and robustness of dexterous hand manipulation tasks.

title: Learning from Demonstrations: A Unified Framework for Imitation and Reinforcement Learning in Dexterous Hands
abstract: This paper proposes a unified framework that combines imitation learning and reinforcement learning to enhance the performance of dexterous hand manipulation by leveraging both expert demonstrations and environment feedback.

title: Real-Time Control of Dexterous Hands Using Model-Free Optimization Techniques
abstract: This paper investigates real-time control strategies for dexterous hands using model-free optimization methods, achieving stable and responsive manipulation in dynamic environments.

title: Learning to Grasp and Manipulate with Imitation Learning and Dynamic Motor Primitives
abstract: This work explores the use of imitation learning combined with dynamic motor primitives to enable dexterous hand manipulation. The approach is validated on a variety of objects and tasks, showing improved generalization compared to traditional control methods.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Hand Manipulation with Contact Sensing
abstract: This paper introduces a model predictive control framework for dexterous hand manipulation that incorporates contact sensing and force feedback. The method improves stability and precision during complex object interactions.

title: Efficient Optimization for Dexterous Hand Movements Using Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: We develop an efficient optimization framework for dexterous hand movements by combining model-based reinforcement learning with trajectory optimization. The approach reduces training time while maintaining high task performance.

title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dexterous Hand Manipulation
abstract: We present a novel reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. Our method demonstrates significant improvements in sample efficiency and task success rates compared to existing approaches.

title: Advanced Dexterous Manipulation Systems: A Comprehensive Review
abstract: This comprehensive review examines the current state of dexterous manipulation systems, covering hardware advances, control algorithms, and future research directions.
conference: IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA)
